00032 //
00033 // Split out three new classes from miVector to distinguish
00034 // vectors, points and normals.
00035 // Use of templates is to avoid rewriting code for all classes
00036 // and to also take advantage of templates for binary operators
00037 //
00038 #ifndef mrVector_h
00039 #define mrVector_h
00040 
00041 // Debug checks
00042 //#ifdef mrMath_h
00043 //#error mrMath.h should be included AFTER mrVector.h or debug compiles can have issues.
00044 //#endif
00045 
00046 #ifndef mrStream_h
00047 #include "mrStream.h"
00048 #endif
00049 
00050 #ifndef mrBase_h
00051 #include "mrBase.h"
00052 #endif
00053 
00054 #ifndef mrMatrix_h
00055 #include "mrMatrix.h"
00056 #endif
00057 
00058 
00059 #ifndef mrSpace_h
00060 #include "mrSpace.h"
00061 #endif
00062 
00063 
00064 #ifndef mrSwizzle_h
00065 #include "mrSwizzle.h"
00066 #endif

00072 // Forward declarations
00073 template< class C, typename T >
00074 struct point_base;
00075 
00076 template< class C, typename T >
00077 struct normal_base;
00078 
00079 struct color;
00080 
00081 typedef normal_base< miVector, miScalar > normal;
00082 typedef  point_base< miVector, miScalar > point;

00091 template < class C, class T >
00092 struct vec3 : public C
00093 {
00094      inline const T      Evaluate( const unsigned short i )   const;
00095      
00096      // functions common to any class with x,y,z 
00097      typedef vec3< C, T > self;
00098 
00099 
00100 
00102      inline operator miColor();
00104      inline operator   color();
00105 
00107      inline vec3();
00108 
00110      inline vec3( const T xx, const T yy, const T zz );
00111 
00112 
00114      
00116      inline       T&     operator[]( const unsigned short i );
00117      
00119      inline const T      operator[]( const unsigned short i )   const;
00120 
00122      inline       void   set( const unsigned short i, const T t );
00123      
00125      inline       void   set( const T xx, const T yy, const T zz );
00126      
00128      inline       T      get( const unsigned short i )   const;
00129      
00130      
00131      //
00133      //
00135      template< class X, class Y, class Oper >
00136      inline const self& operator=( const base::exp< X, Y, Oper >& e );
00138      inline const self& operator=( const self& b );
00140      inline const self& operator=( const C& b );
00142      inline const self& operator=( const T b );
00143 
00144 
00145      //
00147      //
00148      template< class X, class Y, class Oper >
00149      inline const bool operator==( const base::exp< X, Y, Oper >& x ) const;
00150      inline const bool operator==( const self& b ) const;
00151      inline const bool operator==( const miVector& b ) const;
00152      inline const bool operator==( const T b ) const;
00153 
00154      //
00156      //
00157      template< class X, class Y, class Oper >
00158      inline const bool operator!=( const base::exp< X, Y, Oper >& b ) const;
00159      inline const bool operator!=( const self& b ) const;
00160      inline const bool operator!=( const miVector& b ) const;
00161      inline const bool operator!=( const T b ) const;
00162 
00163      //
00165      //
00167      template< class X, class Y, class Oper >
00168      inline const self&  operator+=( const base::exp< X, Y, Oper >& b );
00169      inline const self&  operator+=( const T b );
00170      inline const self&  operator+=( const C& b );
00171 
00173 
00174      template< class X, class Y, class Oper >
00175      inline const self&  operator-=( const base::exp< X, Y, Oper >& b );
00176      inline const self&  operator-=( const T b );
00177      inline const self&  operator-=( const C& b );
00178 
00180 
00181      template< class X, class Y, class Oper >
00182      inline const self&  operator*=( const base::exp< X, Y, Oper >& b );
00183      inline const self&  operator*=( const T b );
00184      inline const self&  operator*=( const C& b );
00185 
00187 
00188      template< class X, class Y, class Oper >
00189      inline const self&  operator/=( const base::exp< X, Y, Oper >& b );
00190      inline const self&  operator/=( const T b );
00191      inline const self&  operator/=( const C& b );
00193 
00194 
00195      //
00197      //
00199      inline self  lessThan( const C& b );
00200      inline self  lessThanEqual( const C& b );
00201      inline self  greaterThan( const C& b );
00202      inline self  greaterThanEqual( const C& b );
00203      // to be used mainly with the return vec of functions above
00204      inline const bool any();
00206 
00207 
00208      inline const bool   isEquivalent( const C& b, 
00209                                        const T tolerance = 
00210                                        miSCALAR_EPSILON ) const;
00211      inline const self&  mix( const C& b, const miScalar p );
00212 
00213      //
00215      //
00217      inline const self& xyz( const    C& t ) { *this = t; return *this; };
00218      inline const self& xyz( const self& t ) { *this = t; return *this; };
00219      inline const self& xyz() const          { return *this; };
00220      inline const self& xyz()                { return *this; };
00221 
00222      // 3 same channels
00223      swizzle(x,x,x); swizzle(y,y,y); swizzle(z,z,z);
00224      // flipped channels
00225      swizzle(z,x,y); swizzle(y,z,x);
00226      swizzle(z,y,x); swizzle(y,x,z);
00227      // combinations
00228      swizzle2(x,y,z);
00229      swizzle2(y,x,z);
00230      swizzle2(z,y,x);
00232 
00233 }; // vec3

00372      inline const self& uv() const { return *this; };
00373      inline       self  vu() const { return self( v, u ); };
00374      inline       self  uu() const { return self( u, u ); };
00375      inline       self  vv() const { return self( v, v ); };

00386 //
00387 // Functions common to vectors and normals
00388 //
00389 template< class C, typename T >
00390 struct vecnorm : public base::vec3< C, T > 
00391 {
00392      typedef vecnorm< C, T > self;
00393 
00394      inline vecnorm();
00395      inline vecnorm( const T xx, const T yy, const T zz );
00396 
00397      // Functions common to vectors & normals 
00398      // (and not points)
00399 
00400      //
00402      //
00404      template< class X, class Y, class Oper >
00405      inline T operator%( const base::exp< X, Y, Oper >& e ) const;
00406      inline T operator%( const miVector& b ) const;
00407 
00408      template< typename X >
00409      inline T dot( const X& b ) { return this->operator%(b) };
00411 
00412 
00413 
00414      inline T       lengthSquared() const;
00415 
00416      inline T       length()        const;
00417 
00418      inline T       inverseLength()      const;
00419      inline T       inverseLengthFast()  const;
00420 
00422      
00423      inline void invert();
00424      inline void normalize();
00425      // faster version of normalize() but less precise
00426      inline void normalizeFast();  
00427 
00429      bool isNormalized() const;
00430 
00432      inline bool     operator< ( const T a ) const;
00433      inline bool     operator> ( const T a ) const;
00434      inline bool     operator<=( const T a ) const;
00435      inline bool     operator>=( const T a ) const;
00436 
00437      inline bool     operator< ( const vecnorm& a ) const;
00438      inline bool     operator> ( const vecnorm& a ) const;
00439      inline bool     operator<=( const vecnorm& a ) const;
00440      inline bool     operator>=( const vecnorm& a ) const;
00441 
00442 
00443    private:
00444      // Invalid operations
00445      inline T    operator%( const point& b ) const;
00446      inline self operator^( const point& b ) const;
00447 };

00450 //
00451 // Functions common to vectors only
00452 //
00453 template< class C, typename T >
00454 struct vec_base : public vecnorm< C, T >
00455 {
00456      
00457      typedef vec_base< C, T > self;
00458 
00459      inline void toTangent( const miState* const state,
00460                             const int idx = 0);
00461      inline void toObject( const miState* const state );
00462      inline void toWorld ( const miState* const state );
00463      inline void toCamera( const miState* const state );
00464      inline void toRaster( const miState* const state );
00465      inline void    toNDC( const miState* const state );
00466      inline void toLight ( const miState* const state );
00467 
00468      inline void fromTangent( const miState* const state,
00469                               const int idx = 0);
00470      inline void fromObject( const miState* const state );
00471      inline void fromWorld ( const miState* const state );
00472      inline void fromCamera( const miState* const state );
00473      inline void fromRaster( const miState* const state );
00474      inline void fromLight ( const miState* const state );
00475 
00476 
00477      inline void to( const miState* const state, 
00478                      const space::type toSpace );
00479 
00480      inline void from( const miState* const state, 
00481                        const space::type fromSpace );
00482 
00483      inline void transform( const miState* const state, 
00484                             const space::type fromSpace,
00485                             const space::type toSpace);
00486 
00487      //
00489      //
00490      inline vec_base();
00491      
00492      template< class X, class Y, class Oper >
00493      inline vec_base( const base::exp< X, Y, Oper >& e );
00494 
00496      inline vec_base( kNoConstruct );
00497 
00499      inline vec_base( const C& b );
00500 
00502      inline vec_base( const T b );
00503 
00505      inline vec_base( const T xx, const T yy, const T zz );
00506 
00508      inline vec_base( const miState* const state, 
00509                       const space::type fromSpace, 
00510                       const C& v );
00511 
00513      inline vec_base( const miState* const state, 
00514                       const space::type fromSpace, 
00515                       const T xx, const T yy, const T zz );
00516 
00517      
00518      //
00520      //
00521      inline vec_base( const self& b );
00522      
00523      //
00525      //
00526      template< class X, class Y, class Oper >
00527      inline const self& operator=( const base::exp< X, Y, Oper >& e );
00528      inline const self& operator=( const self& b );
00529      inline const self& operator=( const C& b );
00530      inline const self& operator=( const T b );
00531 
00532 
00533      //
00535      //
00536      // The choice of ^ as the cross product is to make it more
00537      // similar to prman.
00538      // However, this choice will create issues of operator precedence
00539      //
00540      // Thus, 
00541      //
00542      // C = A ^ B % C;
00543      //
00544      // will not compile without parenthesis.
00545      //
00546      // C = (A ^ B) % C;
00547      //
00549      template< class X, class Y, class Oper >
00550      inline const self& operator^=( const base::exp< X, Y, Oper >& b );
00551      inline const self& operator^=( const miVector& b );
00552 
00553      template< typename X >
00554      inline const self& cross( const X& b );
00555      
00556      template< class X, class Y, class Oper >
00557      inline self operator^( const base::exp< X, Y, Oper >& b ) const;
00558      inline self operator^( const miVector& b ) const;
00560 
00561      
00562      inline self          inverse() const;
00563      inline self        operator-() const;
00564 
00565      inline self  normalized()  const;
00566 
00567      // faster version of normalized() but less precise
00568      inline self  normalizedFast()  const;
00569 
00570      
00571      //
00573      //
00575      
00576      inline const self&  operator*= ( const T b );
00577      inline const self&  operator*= ( const C& b );
00578      inline const self&  operator*= ( const miMatrix a );
00579      inline const self&  operator*=( const matrix& m );
00580 
00582 
00583      // Hmmm... these two cannot be optimized per channel, right?
00584      inline self   operator*( const miMatrix m ) const;
00585      inline self   operator*( const matrix& m ) const;
00586 
00587      // Common constants
00588      static vec_base< C, T > kNull;
00589      static vec_base< C, T > kAxisX;
00590      static vec_base< C, T > kAxisY;
00591      static vec_base< C, T > kAxisZ;
00592      static vec_base< C, T > kUnitScale;
00593 };

00600 template< class C, typename T >
00601 struct normal_base : public vecnorm< C, T >
00602 {
00603      typedef normal_base< C, T > self;
00604 
00605      inline void toTangent( const miState* const state,
00606                             const int idx = 0 );
00607      inline void  toObject( const miState* const state );
00608      inline void   toWorld( const miState* const state );
00609      inline void  toCamera( const miState* const state );
00610      inline void  toRaster( const miState* const state );
00611      inline void     toNDC( const miState* const state );
00612      inline void   toLight( const miState* const state );
00613 
00614      inline void fromTangent( const miState* const state,
00615                               const int idx = 0 );
00616      inline void  fromObject( const miState* const state );
00617      inline void   fromWorld( const miState* const state );
00618      inline void  fromCamera( const miState* const state );
00619      inline void   fromLight( const miState* const state );
00620 
00621 
00622      inline void to( const miState* const state, 
00623                      const space::type toSpace );
00624 
00625      inline void from( const miState* const state, 
00626                        const space::type fromSpace );
00627 
00628      inline void transform( const miState* const state, 
00629                             const space::type fromSpace,
00630                             const space::type toSpace);
00631 
00632      //
00634      //
00636      inline normal_base( kNoConstruct );
00637 
00638      inline normal_base();
00639      
00640      inline normal_base( const C& b );
00641      
00642      inline normal_base( const T b );
00643      
00644      template< class X, class Y, class Oper >
00645      inline normal_base( const base::exp< X, Y, Oper >& e );
00646      
00647     
00648      inline normal_base( const T xx, const T yy = 0.0f, 
00649                          const T zz = 0.0f );
00650 
00651      inline normal_base( const miState* const state, 
00652                          const space::type fromSpace, 
00653                          const T xx, const T yy, const T zz );
00654 
00655      inline normal_base( const miState* const state, 
00656                          const space::type fromSpace, 
00657                          const C& v );
00658 
00660 
00661      
00662      //
00664      //
00665      inline normal_base( const self& b );
00666      
00667      //
00669      //
00671      template< class X, class Y, class Oper >
00672      inline const self& operator=( const base::exp< X, Y, Oper >& e );
00673      inline const self& operator=( const self& b );
00674      inline const self& operator=( const C& b );
00675      inline const self& operator=( const T b );
00677 
00678      //
00680      //
00682      inline const self&  operator*= ( const T b );
00683      inline const self&  operator*= ( const C& b );
00684      inline const self&  operator*= ( const miMatrix a );
00685      inline const self&  operator*= ( const matrix& m );
00687 
00688      //
00690      //
00691      // The choice of ^ as the cross product is to make it more
00692      // similar to prman.
00693      // However, this choice will create issues of operator precedence
00694      //
00695      // Thus, 
00696      //
00697      // C = A ^ B % C;
00698      //
00699      // will not compile without parenthesis.
00700      //
00701      // C = (A ^ B) % C;
00702      //
00704      template< class X, class Y, class Oper >
00705      inline const self& operator^=( const base::exp< X, Y, Oper >& b );
00706      inline const self& operator^=( const miVector& b );
00707 
00708      template< typename X >
00709      inline const self& cross( const X& b );
00710      
00711      template< class X, class Y, class Oper >
00712      inline self operator^( const base::exp< X, Y, Oper >& b ) const;
00713      inline self operator^( const miVector& b ) const;
00715 
00716      
00717      inline self          inverse() const;
00718      inline self        operator-() const;
00719 
00720      inline self  normalized()  const;
00721 
00722      // faster version of normalized() but less precise
00723      inline self  normalizedFast()  const;
00724 
00725      
00726      inline self   operator*  ( const miMatrix m ) const;
00727      inline self   operator*  ( const matrix& m ) const;
00728 };

00796      inline point_base( const T b );

00799      inline point_base( const self& b );
00800

00807      inline const self& operator=( const base::exp< X, Y, Oper >& e );
00808      inline const self& operator=( const self& b );
